content:
This quest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Pirate's TreasureThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Pirate's Treasure
Pirate's Treasure (#16)
Released 11 June 2001 (Update)
Members No
Official difficulty Novice
Lead developer(s) Paul Gower

Pirate's Treasure is a quest in which you help the pirate Redbeard Frank obtain some Karamjan rum in return for the location of the treasure of One-Eyed Hector, his old captain.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
    • 2.1 Captain Redbeard
    • 2.2 The island of Karamja
    • 2.3 Back at Port Sarim
    • 2.4 Buried treasure
  • 3 Reward
  • 4 Required for completing
  • 5 Transcript
  • 6 Trivia

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point The northernmost dock at Port Sarim, just south of the pub.
Official difficultyNovice
DescriptionRedbeard Frank knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of Karamjan rum.
Official lengthVery Short
Requirements Able to defeat or run away from a Combat level 4 gardener.
Items required
  • Karamjan rum (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)
  • White apron (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at Gerrant's Fishy Business.)
  • 60 coins (only 30 is needed if using a Ring of charos(a))
  • 10 bananas (obtainable during the quest)
  • Spade (obtainable during the quest)
Recommended
  • Varrock Teleport
  • Falador Teleport
Enemies to defeat Gardener (level 4, optional)
{"requirements":"Able to defeat or run away from a [[Combat level]] 4 [[gardener]].","desc":"[[Redbeard Frank]] knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]].","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"[[Gardener]] ''(level 4, optional)''","name":"Pirate's Treasure","start":"The northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just south of the [[The Rusty Anchor|pub]].","length":"Very Short","items":"*[[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)\n*[[White apron]] (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])\n*60 [[coins]] (only 30 is needed if using a [[Ring of charos|Ring of charos(a)]])\n*10 [[banana]]s (obtainable during the quest)\n*[[Spade]] (obtainable during the quest)"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Captain Redbeard[edit | edit source]

Items needed: 30 coins.

Talk to Redbeard Frank (located in front the northernmost dock in Port Sarim). He wants you to get some Karamjan rum before he'll tell you the location of the treasure. If you have already completed the quest Rum Deal, your character will ask Redbeard Frank if Braindead Rum will work.

Walk south on the docks to see three sailors (NOT the Monks of Entrana). Talk to any one of these sailors to board the ship to Karamja for 30 coins (or, using a Ring of Charos (a), persuade them to let you sail for free). Disembark the ship once you arrive, and start heading west to the pub.

The island of Karamja[edit | edit source]

Items needed: 10 bananas and 30 coins.

Once at Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers, trade with Zambo the bartender. Buy one Karamjan rum for 30 coins.

Note: Do not leave the island with the rum in your inventory. If you do, the officers will take your rum away, as Asgarnia has banned the import of intoxicating spirits. If you try to teleport off the island, the bottle will break. The bottle will also break if you accept a random event where you are temporarily teleported to the event location to perform the task.

Walk to the hut east of the banana plantation and speak to Luthas. Ask for a job, and he will hire you as his worker. If you mention the customs officer, he says that his crates are not searched. Agree to help him. Enter the banana plantation beside his house and pick 10 bananas from the trees. Note: Picking 5 bananas is an easy Karamja Diary task.

Use your rum on the crate east of the hut to hide it. If you get a message saying "Why would I want to do that?" try asking for employment. Next, fill the crate with bananas. You can use the "Fill-Crate" option to expedite this process. Once the crate is full, talk to Luthas. He will pay you 30 coins. Ask him where the crate goes, and he will tell you they go to Wydin, who owns the food store in Port Sarim. You can use Luthas' payment to pay your fare back to Port Sarim (or, once you've been searched, you can use a Ring of Charos (a) to persuade the customs officer to let you ride for free). Travel back to Port Sarim.

Back at Port Sarim[edit | edit source]

Items needed: White apron
Items recommended: a teleport to Varrock and Falador.

Once you are in Port Sarim, make a quick stop at the fishing shop just to the west. Hanging on the back wall is a white apron. Take it and wear it (the white apron in the back of Wydin's store is inaccessible at this point).

Talk to Wydin at his food store directly south of the fishing shop, and ask him for a job. He will agree if you're wearing your white apron. Enter the back room and search the crate with a banana on top of it. You will find the rum. Do not teleport with it in your inventory. Head back to Redbeard Frank and give him the drink.

Frank will give you a key to the chest found upstairs in Varrock's Blue Moon Inn. Travel or teleport to Varrock, and head to the Blue Moon Inn (it's the pub located just north of the city's southern gate). Go upstairs and find the chest in the room at the end of the hall. Use the key on the chest to find a pirate message. It will give you a clue to the treasure's location. Be sure to read the clue. Now, travel or teleport to Falador, the city of the White Knights.

Buried treasure[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Spade, pirate message
Items recommended: A weapon.
Location of the buried treasure.

Once in Falador, grab a spade from the estate agency just south-west of the park. With the spade in your inventory, head to the park. Find the statue of Saradomin in the middle of the park, and notice where it's pointing. Note the configuration of the dirt, which vaguely makes an X. Stand in the middle of the dirt "X" and dig.

An angry level-4 gardener will appear and attack you. Kill him, or run out of the park, and dig again in the same spot to get a casket and complete the quest.

Congratulations, Quest Complete!

Reward[edit | edit source]

  • 2 Quest points
  • Ability to use the pay-fare option to and from Karamja.
  • Access to One-Eyed Hector's Treasure Chest (contains a gold ring, an emerald, and 450 coins).

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Pirate's Treasure is required for the following:

  • Cabin Fever

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on a quest has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the quest.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When using the Casket received as a reward for completing the quest on Redbeard Frank, the player's character offers to share the treasure with him, but he refuses and insists that the player should keep all of it for their own as they have earned it.
  • When the quest was first released, the Karamja rum was tradeable and the bottles would not break if players tried to teleport. Some players simply bought a whole load of rum and sold it to players doing the quest, allowing them to skip a large part of it. When this was posted on fan forums, a Jagex developer saw it and the problem was soon corrected.
  • If you have completed Rum Deal prior to starting this quest, you will ask Redbeard Frank if Braindeath 'Rum' will do instead instead of Karamjan rum, in which case Redbeard refuses immediately, calling it 'swill'.
  • If you give Redbeard Frank some Karamja rum with sliced banana in it, he will take it at first, but will give it back when talked to again, stating that he doesn't like bananas in his rum.
  • If you give Redbeard Frank some Karamja rum with a banana stuffed in in, he will take it at first, but will give it back, saying "Arr - this here rum's got a banana stuck in it!".

'''Pirate's Treasure''' is a quest in which you help the pirate [[Redbeard Frank]] obtain some [[Karamjan rum]] in return for the location of the treasure of [[One-Eyed Hector]], his old captain.

==Details==
{{Quest details
|start = The northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just south of the [[The Rusty Anchor|pub]].
|difficulty = 1
|description = [[Redbeard Frank]] knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]].
|length = Very Short
|requirements = Able to defeat or run away from a [[Combat level]] 4 [[gardener]].
|items = *[[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)
*[[White apron]] (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])
*60 [[coins]] (only 30 is needed if using a [[Ring of charos|Ring of charos(a)]])
*10 [[banana]]s (obtainable during the quest)
*[[Spade]] (obtainable during the quest)
|recommended = *[[Varrock Teleport]]
*[[Falador Teleport]] 
|kills = [[Gardener]] ''(level 4, optional)''
}}

==Walkthrough==
===Captain Redbeard===
{{Needed|30 [[coins]].}}

Talk to [[Redbeard Frank]] (located in front the northernmost dock in [[Port Sarim]]). He wants you to get some [[Karamjan rum]] before he'll tell you the location of the treasure. If you have already completed the quest [[Rum Deal]], your character will ask Redbeard Frank if Braindead Rum will work.

Walk south on the docks to see three sailors (NOT the [[Monk of Entrana|Monks of Entrana]]). Talk to any one of these sailors to board the ship to [[Karamja]] for 30 [[coins]] (or, using a [[Ring of Charos (a)]], persuade them to let you sail for free). Disembark the ship once you arrive, and start heading west to the pub.

===The island of Karamja===
{{Needed|10 [[bananas]] and 30 [[coins]].}}

Once at [[Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers]], trade with [[Zambo]] the bartender. Buy one [[Karamjan rum]] for 30 coins.

'''Note:''' Do '''not''' leave the island with the rum in your inventory. If you do, the [[Customs officer|officers]] will take your rum away, as [[Asgarnia]] has banned the import of intoxicating spirits. If you try to [[Teleportation|teleport]] off the island, the bottle will break. The bottle will also break if you accept a [[Random events|random event]] where you are temporarily teleported to the event location to perform the task. 

Walk to the hut east of the [[banana plantation]] and speak to [[Luthas]]. Ask for a job, and he will hire you as his worker. If you mention the customs officer, he says that his crates are not searched. Agree to help him. Enter the banana plantation beside his house and pick 10 bananas from the trees. ''Note'': Picking 5 bananas is an [[Karamja Diary#Easy|easy Karamja Diary]] task.

'''Use''' your rum on the crate east of the hut to hide it. ''If you get a message saying "Why would I want to do that?" try asking for employment.'' Next, fill the crate with bananas. You can use the "Fill-Crate" option to expedite this process. Once the crate is full, '''talk to Luthas'''. He will pay you 30 coins. Ask him where the crate goes, and he will tell you they go to [[Wydin]], who owns the food store in [[Port Sarim]]. You can use Luthas' payment to pay your fare back to Port Sarim (or, once you've been searched, you can use a Ring of Charos (a) to persuade the customs officer to let you ride for free). Travel back to Port Sarim.

===Back at Port Sarim===
{{Needed|[[White apron]]|recommended=a teleport to [[Varrock Teleport|Varrock]] and [[Falador Teleport|Falador]].}}

Once you are in Port Sarim, make a quick stop at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business|the fishing shop]] just to the west. Hanging on the back wall is a [[white apron]]. Take it and wear it ''(the white apron in the back of Wydin's store is inaccessible at this point).'' 

Talk to [[Wydin]] at his [[Wydin's Food Store|food store]] directly south of the fishing shop, and ask him for a job. He will agree if you're wearing your white apron. Enter the back room and search the crate with a [[banana]] on top of it. You will find the rum. '''Do not teleport with it in your inventory.''' Head back to [[Redbeard Frank]] and give him the drink.

Frank will give you a [[Chest key (Pirate's Treasure)|key]] to the chest found upstairs in [[Varrock|Varrock's]] [[Blue Moon Inn]]. Travel or teleport to Varrock, and head to the Blue Moon Inn (it's the pub located just north of the city's southern gate). Go upstairs and find the chest in the room at the end of the hall. Use the key on the chest to find a [[pirate message]]. It will give you a clue to the treasure's location. Be sure to ''read the clue''. Now, travel or teleport to [[Falador]], the ''city of the White Knights''.

===Buried treasure===
{{Needed|[[Spade]], [[pirate message]]|recommended=A [[weapon]].}}
[[File:Pirate's Treasure - Buried treasure location.png|thumb|284x284px|Location of the buried treasure.]]

Once in Falador, grab a spade from the estate agency just south-west of the park. With the spade in your inventory, head to the park.
Find the statue of [[Saradomin]] in the middle of the park, and notice where it's pointing. Note the configuration of the dirt, which vaguely makes an X. Stand in the middle of the dirt "X" and dig.

An angry level-4 [[gardener]] will appear and attack you. Kill him, or run out of the park, and dig again in the same spot to get a casket and complete the quest.

'''Congratulations, Quest Complete!'''

==Reward==
{{Quest rewards
|name = Pirate's Treasure
|image = [[File:Pirate's Treasure reward scroll.png|centre]]
|qp = 2
|rewards =
*Ability to use the pay-fare option to and from [[Karamja]].
*Access to [[Casket (Pirate's Treasure)|One-Eyed Hector's Treasure Chest]] (contains a [[gold ring]], an [[emerald]], and 450 [[coins]]).
}}

==Required for completing==
Completion of Pirate's Treasure is required for the following:
*[[Cabin Fever]]

==Transcript==
{{Hastranscript|quest}}

==Trivia==
*When using the Casket received as a reward for completing the quest on Redbeard Frank, the player's character offers to share the treasure with him, but he refuses and insists that the player should keep all of it for their own as they have earned it.
*When the quest was first released, the [[Karamja rum]] was tradeable and the bottles would not break if players tried to teleport. Some players simply bought a whole load of rum and sold it to players doing the quest, allowing them to skip a large part of it. When this was posted on fan forums, a Jagex developer saw it and the problem was soon corrected.
*If you have completed [[Rum Deal]] prior to starting this quest, you will ask Redbeard Frank if [[Braindeath 'Rum']] will do instead instead of Karamjan rum, in which case Redbeard refuses immediately, calling it 'swill'.
*If you give Redbeard Frank some [[Karamjan rum (sliced banana)|Karamja rum with sliced banana]] in it, he will take it at first, but will give it back when talked to again, stating that he doesn't like bananas in his rum.
*If you give Redbeard Frank some [[Karamjan rum (banana)|Karamja rum with a banana]] stuffed in in, he will take it at first, but will give it back, saying "Arr - this here rum's got a banana stuck in it!".

{{Pirate's Treasure}}
